products.description: Lifewave X39: X39 is known for its stem cell activation benefits, but it can also contribute to overall stress reduction. By supporting the body's natural healing and regenerative processes, it may help improve the body's ability to cope with stress.

Aeon is designed to reduce inflammation and stress. It may help calm the nervous system and promote a sense of relaxation. Aeon patches can be placed on specific acupuncture points to aid in stress reduction.

High-stress levels can often disrupt sleep patterns. Silent Nights patches are designed to improve the quality of sleep by addressing imbalances in the body's energy system. Better sleep can contribute to stress reduction.

The LifeWave Energy Enhancer patches are specifically designed to increase energy, stamina, and endurance. These patches utilize a combination of amino acids, herbal extracts, and nutrients to support the body's energy production processes.

Although primarily recognized for its detoxification benefits, glutathione can also support cellular function and energy production. By promoting a healthy cellular environment, glutathione patches may help increase energy levels.

If poor sleep quality or lack of restful sleep is a contributing factor to low energy, Silent Nights patches may be beneficial. These patches use non-transdermal technology to support natural sleep patterns, promoting deep and restorative sleep.

While Aeon is known for its anti-inflammatory properties, it can also have an indirect impact on energy levels. By reducing inflammation and stress in the body, Aeon patches can help optimize overall health and well-being, which can translate to improved energy levels.

IceWave patches can be used to address pain and discomfort, which may be contributing to low energy levels. By reducing pain and promoting overall wellness, these patches can help improve energy and vitality.

The X39 patch can be beneficial for stem cell activation, which supports overall health and vitality. While it may not directly target the Yin of Lungs specifically, overall health improvements can have a positive impact on respiratory function. It is typically placed on the upper body, preferably over the upper back area near the shoulder blades.

The Carnosine patch is known for its potential benefits for heart tissues and respiratory problems. Placing the Carnosine patch on the upper chest area, over the heart and lungs, may be helpful for individuals with low Yin of Lungs energy.

The Aeon patch is known for its anti-inflammatory properties and stress reduction benefits. While it may not directly target the Yin of Lungs, it can help with reducing inflammation in the respiratory system. Placing the Aeon patch on the upper chest or near the lungs can be beneficial.

The Glutathione patch is primarily associated with detoxification, liver health, and gallbladder health. While it may not specifically address the Yin of Lungs, supporting liver function can indirectly benefit respiratory health. Placing the Glutathione patch on the right side of the body, over the liver area, is recommended.

IceWave patches can be used to balance the energy of the Large Intestine meridian. The white patch is typically applied on the right side of the body, in the area of the Large Intestine 4 (LI4) acupuncture point, which is located in the webbing between the thumb and index finger. The tan patch is placed on the left side of the body, on the opposite corresponding point.

Although X39 is primarily known for its benefits in stem cell activation, it may also have positive effects on overall stress reduction. It can be placed on acupuncture points associated with the Large Intestine meridian, such as LI4 or LI11.

Aeon patches are beneficial for reducing inflammation and stress. They can be applied to acupuncture points associated with the Large Intestine meridian, such as LI11, located at the outer end of the elbow crease.
Glutathione patches can support detoxification and overall health. They can be placed over the area of the liver, which is typically on the right side of the body, just below the rib cage.

Aeon patches can be beneficial for inflammation and stress reduction. Placing an Aeon patch on the acupuncture point known as 'Stomach 36' (located below the knee, four finger widths down from the kneecap, on the outside of the shinbone) may help support the balance of the Yang of Stomach.

X39 patches are known for their potential to activate stem cells and support overall well-being. Placing an X39 patch on the acupuncture point known as 'Stomach 36' may provide additional support to the Yang of Stomach.

Aeon patches can be placed on the Spleen 3 acupressure point, which is located on the inner side of the foot, about three finger-widths above the prominence of the inner ankle bone. Stimulating this point may help promote balance in the Spleen's Yin energy and reduce stress.

Carnosine patches can be placed on the chest area, near the heart. While Carnosine is known for its benefits to heart tissues and respiratory problems, it can also indirectly support the overall energy balance in the body, including the Spleen's Yin energy.

Glutathione patches can be placed on the liver area, which is located on the right side of the body, just below the rib cage. The liver plays a significant role in supporting the Spleen's functions, and supporting liver health can indirectly benefit the Spleen.

IceWave patches can be placed on the Spleen 6 acupressure point, which is located about four finger-widths above the inner ankle bone. This point is known to help balance the Yin energy of the Spleen.

The Aeon patch is known for its potential benefits in reducing inflammation and stress. Placing the Aeon patch on the HT7 acupoint, which is located on the inner wrist, can help harmonize the Yin energy of the Heart and promote a sense of calmness.

The Carnosine patch can be beneficial for heart tissues and respiratory problems. Placing the Carnosine patch on the PC6 acupoint, which is located on the inner forearm, about two finger-widths up from the wrist crease, can help balance the Yin energy of the Heart and support heart and respiratory functions.

The X39 patch can be beneficial for overall stem cell activation and stress reduction. Placing the X39 patch on the CV17 acupoint, which is located in the center of the chest, can help support heart health and balance the Yin energy of the Heart.

Glutathione patches can support detoxification, liver health, and gallbladder health. Placing the Glutathione patch on the LV3 acupoint, which is located on the top of the foot, between the big toe and second toe, can help regulate the flow of energy in the liver meridian and support overall liver and gallbladder health.

To apply the SP6 Complete patch, it is typically recommended to place it on the inside of the wrist, just above the wrist crease. This location corresponds to the acupressure point known as the 'Inner Gate' or 'P6' point, which is associated with the Small Intestine meridian.

Aeon patches are designed to help reduce inflammation and stress. For supporting bladder health, the Aeon patch can be placed on the lower abdomen area, just above the pubic bone. This placement aims to provide general support to the bladder region.

IceWave patches consist of two patches√ëone white (Yin) and one tan (Yang). The white patch is typically placed on the Yang acupuncture point, and the tan patch is placed on the Yin acupuncture point. These points are located on the feet.

IceWave patches are designed to promote balance and harmony in the body. The white patch can be placed on the Yang side of the body, while the tan patch can be placed on the Yin side. For Yin imbalance of the Kidneys, you can try placing the white IceWave patch on the Yin side of the body, which is the left side.
